trans-unit.source: This binding element can be used to enable Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) applications to send messages to and receive messages from existing MSMQ applications that use either COM, MSMQ native APIs, or the APIs in <xref href="System.Messaging"></xref>.
Use this class to send and receive messages from MSMQ-based messaging applications.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBindingElement"></xref> class.
Builds a channel factory using the context provided.
This method builds a channel factory that enables the developer to create a client channel to communicate with a service.
The channel factory is not a channel, but rather a factory that can create a channel.
You create a channel by calling `IChannelFactory<TChannel>.CreateChannel`.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> with which to build the channel factory.
The type of channel.
An MSMQ integration channel factory that can be used to create channels to send messages to existing MSMQ applications.
The context value is `null`.
The TChannel is not `IOutputChannel`.

<xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode"></xref> is Certificate or WindowsDomain and <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel"></xref> is None.
Builds a channel listener using the context provided.
Channel listeners are created on the service and are used to receive messages sent by a client channel.
The service must call `IChannelListener.Open` and then `IChannelListener.AcceptChannel` to get a reference to the actual channel.
Then `IChannel.Open` must be called to open the channel.
At this point, the channel can be used to retrieve messages.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> with which to build the channel listener.
The type of channel.
An MSMQ integration channel listener that can be used to create channels to receive messages from existing MSMQ applications.
The context value is `null`.
The TChannel is not `IInputChannel`.

<xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqAuthenticationMode"></xref> is Certificate or WindowsDomain and <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqTransportSecurity.MsmqProtectionLevel"></xref> is None.
Returns a value that indicates whether you can build a channel factory with the context provided.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> with which to build the channel factory.
The type of channel.
`true` if you can build a channel factory with the context provided; otherwise, `false`.
This method returns `true` only if TChannel is .
Returns a value that indicates whether you can build a channel listener with the context provided.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext"></xref> with which to build the channel listener.
The type of channel.
`true` if you can build a channel listener with the context provided; otherwise, `false`.
This method returns `true` only if TChannel is .
Returns a clone of the binding element.
A clone of the binding element.
Gets a property of the requested type from the specified `BindingContext`.
This method provides the functionality to retrieve capabilities and protection requirements from the element.
The binding context.
The type of property.
An object of type T.
Context is `null`.
Gets a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the scheme used by the binding element.
This property returns the string "msmq.formatname" to indicate the addressing scheme used by the MSMQ integration channel.
For more information about queue addressing, see [Service Endpoints and Queue Addressing](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/service-endpoints-and-queue-addressing.md).
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the scheme used by the binding element.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat"></xref> to be used when serializing MSMQ messages.
This property can have one of the following values:
`ActiveX` - The ActiveX serializer is used to serialize objects.
`Binary` - The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryFormatter> is used to serialize objects.
`ByteArray` - The object is serialized to an array of bytes.
`Stream` - The object is serialized to a stream.
`Xml` - The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> is used to serialize objects.
The default value is `Xml`.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat"></xref> to be used when serializing MSMQ messages.
The value is not within the values of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat"></xref>.
Gets or sets an array of <xref href="System.Type"></xref> objects that contain the types to which messages should be deserialized.
The body of an MSMQ message is not typed.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBindingElement.TargetSerializationTypes%2A> property enables you to specify the types to which messages are deserialized when they are sent from an MSMQ application to a [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] receiving application.
This property is used only if <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat> is set to `Xml`.
An array of <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that contains the types to which messages should be deserialized.
